oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Motor Express Softies ready to ride, from the Nashville Times, 1940
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A captioned photo from the Nashville Times (1940), about the Hoover Motor Express Softball Team. The caption reads: “Here is a softball team that should be ready to roll when it enters one of the regular leagues next week. It’s the recently organized Hoover Motor Express club, said one of the strongest independent softball outfit[s] in the city. The team, left to right, bottom row: Cartwright, Montgomery, Jones Locke, Harris and Puckett. Top row: Barton, Manning, Sircy, Bass, Meadors, S. W. Barton and Miller, manager.��� The 1941 City Directory cites the address of the Hoover Motor Express Company at “Fast Freight Lines, 414 5th Av S.” Forms part of the Nashville Times newspaper collection. 1 digital photo.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Hoover Motor Express (Nashville, Tenn.)
